data.title: [Feature Request] GDScript to support external python modules
data.body: I know this is big...BIG.  But it would be BIG. This would let you hook into the entire Python ecosystem, more or less.  It boggles the mind.

data.title: MySql built-in class
data.body: something like Python's MySqldb or SQLAlchemy

data.title: Multiple resource packs
data.body: Seamless loading of multiple zip/pck resource packs in a manner similar to [PhysicsFS](http://icculus.org/physfs/).

data.title: Timer, TooltipPanel and TooltipLabel objects created in random places in SceneTree
data.body: I was just studing my SceneTree for some memory leaks in Info tab, and what I've noticed is a lot of stange objects that I did not make. There is a lot ot Timers, TooltipPanels and TooltipLabels a it's child - they are always together. Where do they come from? They are like in many different, quite random places.

data.title: Simple scene as a loading screen / boot splash
data.body: Now there is only and option to load a simple picture as a splash screen. How about using some fair simple scene - with some lightweight animations and so on. Do you think that this is to much?

data.title: Fade in / fade out / loop from specific time in audio
data.body: I look future forward for fade in / fade out effect in audio, with custom lenth of fading. Also looping, but not from the beginning, but from custom moment of time. It would give a nice freedom in use if those two would be used together simultaneously.

data.title: Include directive or autoloads as global variables
data.body:
I would REALLY like an "include" directive.  I just got finished pasting:

 var logger

func _enter_tree():
    logger = get_node("/root/Logger")

near the top off all my scripts. (or is there a better way to do this?)

data.title: get_contact_collider_shape_metadata takes wrong argument, and returns void
data.body:
First, there are some problems in the documentation:
- KinematicBody2D: get_collider_metadata() and get_collider() methods are listed as returning void, but they actually return something if you try them.
- Physics2DDirectBodyState: get_contact_collider_shape_metadata() is also listed as returning null, and taking contact_idx as parameter.

Since the function to get a collider's metadata actually worked in KinematicBody, I tried it too in Physics2DDirectBodyState. However, if you provide the contact index as the parameter, the game crashes.
I made a minimal example showing this crash here: https://github.com/Zamaroht/crash_example

After speaking with romulox_x on IRC, he found out that the parameter this method actually takes is the number returned by get_contact_collider_shape(). However, by using that number the game doesn't crash, but it doesn't return anything.

Since get_collider_metadata() returns the tile position of a Tilemap in KinematicBody2D, I'd expect get_contact_collider_shape_metadata() to return this same data.

Is it actually a bug or am I missing something? Thanks!

data.title: AutoLoad script order
data.body:
Since, in some cases, order would matter when the engine is calling _ready() in Autoloaded scripts, it would be nice if you could move them up and down in the Project Settings->Autoload list. To move one to the top of the list so it loads first you have to remove all of them then re-add them in the correct order.

A workaround, of course, is to not use _ready() but have a init() function that gets called by the _ready() function of another autoloaded script that calls the inits in the correct order.

data.title: fix typo error in Color::invert, fixes #1967
data.body: color B in RGB wasn't being inverted properly.

data.title: The ability to move nodes around in the list for Organization and the ability to move nodes to different parents and shift select.
data.body:
I don't know about you but I like some organization in the list of my nodes. Currently, the only way to do this is to get it right the first time, which is nearly impossible with the changes that occur in a game's development. I would like the ability to grab and drop a node to a different place on the list.

Also, there isn't a way yet to move nodes to different parents. It's annoying to do a lot of work on a particular node only to realize that it would be better moved somewhere else. Now, you could copy the script over, but there's also the case of non-script based work that's don't to nodes. This isn't easily ported over. There's also the issue of dependencies, but that can be worked out. It would be great to just grab and drop nodes into different parents.

Another bit for the list UI, you can control + click to select multiple nodes, but not shift + click, which can be especially useful in larger projects.

data.title: The ability to delete files from the editor.
data.body:
There currently is no easy way to delete files from Godot. Currently the only way to do this is by closing the file in Godot and then deleting the file from the directory it's in, and even this has some errors with being "unable to find" the file.

Also, in the case of dependencies, perhaps Godot can tell you what depends on the file so you could then change the lines it highlighted to not depend on the file.

data.title: Wrong default resolution in android
data.body:
Hello,

I just started with godot and created a simple gui (just some panels and buttons). But when I exported to android with **stretch_mode = 2d** and **stretch_aspect = keep** in project settings, some parts of the gui were missing. After some testing I found out that when I set the diplay width and height or just checked both option, everything worked as expected.

It's just a small issue, but it really confused me.

Lastly: thanks for an awesome game engine and for making it open source.

data.title: Replace color phases with color ramp for Particles2D. (need some review/guidance)
data.body:
I've tried to replace color phases for particles 2d with more convenient to use color ramp with dedicated editor. I'm completely not sure that I did everything correctly, especially from multithreading point of view, but at least it works. So it would be nice to hear some advices or ways of improvement of this patch.
To do this task I made a copy of existing gradient editor from shader graph editor and do some modifications to it (I decided to try replace original one with modified version later). 
So what was done:
-new resource for color ramp  + editor
-backward compatibility. Old coloring for particles 2d will be converted to color ramp (or to new color property if only one color phase was used before).
-undo/redo support.
![colorramp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10543859/7789160/db0fa4f0-025f-11e5-9d3d-472ba1bc2898.png)
![particlecolorramp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10543859/7789161/e08fb51e-025f-11e5-92f2-c8c9ec00f376.gif)

data.title: Setting build vs properties in scons.
data.body: This sets up the nmake build properties in visual studio. The build properties are limited to the build settings you used when making the vsproj. so if you built the vs project files with debug all of the vs configurations will use target debug.

data.title: Missing function in Color (1.1)
data.body:
**Color**
void Color ( int from )
Construct the color from an RGBA profile.

**Color**
void Color ( String from )
Construct the color from an RGBA profile.

data.title: 2D Visibility Mask
data.body:
We tried our hardest to make a 2D visibility mask yesterday, but we had to resort to using scroll boxes instead.

We aren't the only ones who need this feature.  See http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1015.   He ended up porting his game to 3D, so he could have a visibility mask.  He also has screenshots detailing the effect.

data.title: Encrypt/Decrypt string variable with GDscript
data.body:
It would be great to have simple way for encrypt/decrypt string like this.

```
var message = "1234abcd"
var rawarray_encrypted_str = encrypt(message,"key")
var message_decrypted = decrypt(rawarray_encrypted_str, "key")
```

I think it's very useful when send/receive some messages over network.

data.title: Game exits without error if an inexistent subclass constructor is called
Really small typo at core/color.cpp
Improved iOS Game Center functions
data.body: Fixed null pointer bug in ios store. added functions to game center to reset the user's achievements, request all the achievements they've made progress on, request descriptions of all possible achievements, and show the built in game center overlay.  Upgraded all (I think) deprecated functions to ios 6 versions.  as per discussion with reduz on IRC, ios 6 is now the official lowest supported iOS version.  compatibility could be added, but it's so obsolete, it's tough to argue for continuing to support it.  some naming of functions and dictionary parameters might need to change.  I just named them whatever made sense to me :)

data.title: Mouse position offset in W10
data.body:
The mouse pointer appears to be above the actual click point. In other words, I have to put the mouse about 10-20px above the button/ui element I want to press to actually click it. 

Spec details:

W10 10122
2 monitors, 1440p and 1680x1050, no scaling, both have the issue.

data.title: Update wiki documentation about -export CLI switch
data.body:
There are some bits of documentation here about the -export switch that can be used to export a project directly from the command line: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/command_line#exporting

Two things that could be improved:
- `-export Windows` does not work actually. The expected target name is `Windows Desktop`. As for the other targets, they are not easy to guess, so they should probably be documented too (or you could say that the exact same name should be used as in the export GUI, i.e. "Linux X11", "Mac OSX", etc.).
- In "The version of Godot that is headless (no video) is ideal for this.", it would be nice to specify that the headless version of godot is actually the "server" version.

data.title: Fix building release target with debug symbols
data.body:
This forced the -g2 CCFLAG in release builds, making them relatively heavy.
Fixes #1781.

data.title: Update dates on roadmap
data.body: The roadmap is very useful for people to see what the near future looks like for Godot, unfortunately the dates are wrong, providing incorrect information.

data.title: Ternary conditional operator
data.body:
"If this do this else this" is such a common operation and the reason ternaries exist in almost all modern languages. Them missing is especially egregious in languages with syntactic whitespace. (4 lines for a simple choice.)

Python's ternary syntax is both readable and non-cryptic.

```
a if test else b
```

data.title: len built-in
data.body:
I used to wonder why Python had len as a built-in instead of a member but considering that Godot is inconsistent (String has length but Array has size?) I think I see why. It is such a common operation to know how big an object is that it being inconsistent isn't cool. (Principle of least surprise etc..)

I think either consider adding a built-in or making the names for length members consistent.

data.title: Tooltips flashing in Editor UI on Windows
data.body:
There is an annoying bug in the Windows version that makes tooltips in the editor to not show correctly, but instead to constantly flash on and off:

https://youtu.be/oUM-cz9hKq8

Both the 64bit and 32bit versions seem to be affected.

System: Windows 8.1
Version tested: 1.1stable

data.title: OptionButton Font should also affect the Items in dropdown list
data.body:
Changing the font of an OptionButton to one with a bigger size seems to only affect the selected Item displayed inside the OptionButton but not the items in the drop down list.
Choosing the correct item from the OptionButton on a mobile device is mere chance because the items are really tiny.

data.title: export to apk error:"'jarsigner' returned with error #1"
data.body:
This is still an issue with 1.1stable.
Tried Oracle Java 7 and 8.
